title: Seafarer’s Festival for landlubbers
text:
Weather: Hobart 8 °C - 20 °C . Light rain developing. Entertainment Bellerive’s annual Seafarers Festival welcomes landlubbers for salty fun by: Seafarer's Festival preview pic. MC's for tommorrow's Seafarer's Festival — Colin Dean (wearing a black hat) and Andrew Colrain are getting ready for the event. Picture MATTHEW THOMPSON. Source: News Corp Australia 
HOLD on to your pirate’s hat and find your sea legs because nautical adventures await. 
The annual Seafarers’ Festival is on today at Bellerive, offering a day of maritime-themed entertainment. 
This year’s festival coincides with National Discover Sailing Day, so festival goers will have an abundance of water-based activities to choose from. 
Lindisfarne Sailing Club will have a range of dinghies on display and will take hearty types out on the water for a free spin. 
The Living Boat Trust will also be on hand to take people out rowing, while the Clarence Sea Scouts will take explorers around Kangaroo Bay on a Scout patrol boat. 
Clarence City Council events co-ordinator Wendy Moles said the Seafarers’ Festival promised something for everyone, with plenty of food, entertainment and educational activities for those wanting to stay on land.
